jobs.title: Senior Full-stack Engineer (React/.NET) - Health Care (Latam)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Truelogic

At Truelogic we are a leading provider of nearshore staff augmentation services headquartered in New York. For over two decades, we’ve been delivering top-tier technology solutions to companies of all sizes, from innovative startups to industry leaders, helping them achieve their digital transformation goals.

Our team of 600+ highly skilled tech professionals, based in Latin America, drives digital disruption by partnering with U.S. companies on their most impactful projects. Whether collaborating with Fortune 500 giants or scaling startups, we deliver results that make a difference.

By applying for this position, you’re taking the first step in joining a dynamic team that values your expertise and aspirations. We aim to align your skills with opportunities that foster exceptional career growth and success while contributing to transformative projects that shape the future.

Our Client

Forward-thinking, growth-oriented healthcare services and technology company that provides state-of-the-art pharmacy solutions, with a presence in the market ever since 2015.


Job Summary

Senior Software Engineer (Full Stack) will be expected to deliver stellar results as part of a small, cross- functional, largely autonomous product engineering team, collaborating strongly with other developers, designers, and the product manager to extend our cloud-based web platform. This role will contribute to features and projects, from brainstorming, development, through to testing, release, and maintenance.

Responsibilities

  • To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the following satisfactorily; other duties may be assigned.

  • Build products for internal and external users across the stack and a firm understanding of web frameworks, APIs, databases, and multiple back-end languages.

  • Partner with engineering managers, lead engineers, product managers and designers to deeply understand the needs of our users to architect and leverage most effective technical solution to build a product that serves those needs.

  • Design and develop software capable of reaching millions of users.

  • Write modular, secure, and well-tested code.

  • Ensure our development environment is best in class by delivering improvements to internal tooling and direct partnership with our product platform teams.

  • Articulate a technical vision for a more enlightened way of working and work with multi-functional partners to deliver that vision.

  • Ensure code quality and participate in code reviews.

  • Promote collaboration and best practices such as simplicity, automation, good design patterns, code coverage and reusability.

  • Own and maintain existing application platforms as part of the team, and look for opportunities to improve them.

  • Ability to work in fast-paced environments where iterative improvements and rapid testing cycles are essential.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • 5+ years of work-related industry experience developing high-performance web applications in C#/ .NET

  • 3+ years of experience as a Full Stack Engineer and knowledge of Front End languages such as JavaScript, React, NextJs.

  • Extensive knowledge of your development stack; for example with C#, have a comprehensive understanding of the .NET, .NET Core, MVC, WebAPI, IIS etc.

  • Experience writing RESTful microservices with a popular web framework.

  • Strong CS fundamentals with experience across a range of disciplines, with one or more areas of deep knowledge and experience.

  • Basic knowledge of working with relational databases such as MSSQL, MySQL etc.

  • Experience working with AWS offerings such as EC2, ALBs, RDS, Beanstalk, API Gateway or with a different cloud provider and similar services.

What We Offer

  • 100% Remote Work: Enjoy the freedom to work from the location that helps you thrive. All it takes is a laptop and a reliable internet connection.

  • Highly Competitive USD Pay: Earn an excellent, market-leading compensation in USD, that goes beyond typical market offerings.

  • Paid Time Off: We value your well-being. Our paid time off policies ensure you have the chance to unwind and recharge when needed.

  • Work with Autonomy: Enjoy the freedom to manage your time as long as the work gets done. Focus on results, not the clock.

  • Work with Top American Companies: Grow your expertise working on innovative, high-impact projects with Industry-Leading U.S. Companies.

Why You’ll Like Working Here

  • A Culture That Values You: We prioritize well-being and work-life balance, offering engagement activities and fostering dynamic teams to ensure you thrive both personally and professionally.

  • Diverse, Global Network: Connect with over 600 professionals in 25+ countries, expand your network, and collaborate with a multicultural team from Latin America.

  • Team Up with Skilled Professionals: Join forces with senior talent. All of our team members are seasoned experts, ensuring you're working with the best in your field.

Apply now!

jobs.title: Firmware Engineer (Embedded Systems) - Health Care
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Truelogic

At Truelogic we are a leading provider of nearshore staff augmentation services headquartered in New York. For over two decades, we’ve been delivering top-tier technology solutions to companies of all sizes, from innovative startups to industry leaders, helping them achieve their digital transformation goals.

Our team of 600+ highly skilled tech professionals, based in Latin America, drives digital disruption by partnering with U.S. companies on their most impactful projects. Whether collaborating with Fortune 500 giants or scaling startups, we deliver results that make a difference.

By applying for this position, you’re taking the first step in joining a dynamic team that values your expertise and aspirations. We aim to align your skills with opportunities that foster exceptional career growth and success while contributing to transformative projects that shape the future.

Our Client

The client is creating a fundamentally better healthcare experience for people with chronic health conditions and those that care for them. They make healthcare more accessible by simplifying complex care plans, connecting care teams and meeting patients where they live. Through their conversational AI, patients use their voice to interact with their digital care companion, who proactively gives medication reminders, symptom checks, behavioral nudges and even engages in friendly conversation to ease loneliness. The client uses radar to put the patient in context and passively monitors their activities, including: heart rate, breathing rate and sleep stages, all without a wearable. The result is informed and timely intervention that drives improved clinical outcomes, reduced care delivery costs and a more satisfactory healthcare experience for all.


Job Summary

They are building a breakthrough healthcare device that uses radar sensing to track vital signs (heart rate, respiration, sleep stages) and integrates with an LLM-powered companion chatbot. Backed by a strategic partner, they’re on a mission to transform senior care by reducing costs and improving outcomes.

Responsibilities

  • Bring up radios and sensors: LTE, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, radar.

  • Develop and maintain drivers and board support packages.

  • Implement reliable OTA update and monitoring systems.

  • Debug and stabilize firmware in a multi-sensor environment.

  • Optimize for resource constraints (memory, threading, power, concurrency).

  • Collaborate on backend/LLM API integrations.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • 3–5+ years hands-on firmware development in C/C++ on embedded/RTOS/Linux systems.

  • Recent track record of shipping embedded systems (not just legacy experience).

  • Experience with radios and sensor bring-up (LTE, BT, Wi-Fi, radar).

  • Strong debugging skills with tools like JTAG, logic analyzers, crash analysis, watchdogs.

  • Knowledge of resource-constrained environments.

  • Startup-ready: thrive in a fast-paced, no-ramp-up environment.

  • Located in Latin America.

  • Fluent English

What We Offer

  • 100% Remote Work: Enjoy the freedom to work from the location that helps you thrive. All it takes is a laptop and a reliable internet connection.

  • Highly Competitive USD Pay: Earn an excellent, market-leading compensation in USD, that goes beyond typical market offerings.

  • Paid Time Off: We value your well-being. Our paid time off policies ensure you have the chance to unwind and recharge when needed.

  • Work with Autonomy: Enjoy the freedom to manage your time as long as the work gets done. Focus on results, not the clock.

The AI Engineer will play a pivotal role in designing, developing, and deploying AI-powered solutions that enhance immersive, high-performance web experiences for global clients. This position combines hands-on technical work with strategic solution design, requiring expertise in machine learning algorithms, data processing, and AI infrastructure. The ideal candidate will be a collaborative problem solver, adept at translating business goals into scalable AI architectures while ensuring performance, security, and accessibility.

  • Stay informed on emerging AI trends and technologies, contributing innovative ideas to the company’s AI strategy.

  • Lead deployment of AI solutions into production, ensuring seamless integration with existing systems.

  • Continuously optimize AI systems for performance, reliability, and accuracy.

  • Produce clear and comprehensive technical documentation.

  • Experience working with large language models (LLMs), fine-tuning, and deploying them at scale.

  • Expertise with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), plus exposure to AWS and Azure.

A global creative technology group that blends design and engineering at scale to help leading brands navigate emerging technologies and changing consumer behaviors.


Job Summary

We’re seeking a Solutions Architect with deep expertise in ContentStack to lead the replatforming of a major website from WordPress to a modern headless CMS. This is a short-term, 1.5-month project, where you’ll act as the technical visionary, designing a scalable, efficient, and future-proof content architecture that maximizes the power of the ContentStack platform.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze existing WordPress plugins, themes, and custom functionality to define the migration strategy and headless replacements.

  • Create detailed technical specifications, architecture diagrams, and best practice guidelines for the development team.

  • Select and integrate complementary technologies (e.g., Next.js, Gatsby, CDNs, DAMs) to complete the solution.

  • Advise on ContentStack stack, environment, and user management strategies.

  • Provide expert guidance on headless CMS concepts, performance, security, and scalability.

  • Troubleshoot technical challenges and validate solutions during implementation.

It was founded by a former senior executive from a prominent global investment management firm.


Job Summary

We are seeking a seasoned Full-Stack Developer who is comfortable operating across the entire stack and contributing to all phases of the development lifecycle. As part of a lean and dynamic team, the ideal candidate will not only bring strong software engineering skills but also have an interest in DevOps practices, including experience or exposure to AWS, deployment pipelines, and infrastructure management. This role requires a proactive problem-solver who can work independently and collaboratively, with a solid understanding of modern development frameworks and a willingness to dive into both front-end and back-end challenges to deliver scalable, high-quality solutions.

Responsibilities

  • Design, build, and maintain scalable back-end services using Python and Django.

  • Develop and optimize modern front-end applications using Vue.js and Vite.

  • Collaborate with DevOps to manage infrastructure using Terraform and CDK for Terraform.

  • Utilize Docker and Docker Compose to streamline local development and deployment processes.

  • Implement secure and efficient secrets management with 1Password CLI.

  • Contribute to CI/CD pipelines and manage production deployments using Uvicorn, Nginx, and container orchestration tools.

  • Debug and troubleshoot full-stack issues using tools such as VSCode and remote debugging techniques.

  • Mentor junior developers and actively participate in architectural and technical decision-making.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • 5+ years of professional software development experience.

  • Strong proficiency in Python, with hands-on experience in Django or similar frameworks.

  • Solid understanding of JavaScript and modern front-end frameworks, particularly with React or Vue.

  • Experience with Docker and containerized development for streamlined local environments.

  • Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code tools such as Terraform and CDK for Terraform (CDKTF).

  • Comfortable working in Unix/macOS environments, using tools like Homebrew, nvm, and pyenv.

  • Experience with web server configuration, including tools like Nginx and Uvicorn.

  • Knowledge of secure development practices and secrets management.

jobs.title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer (PHP) - Fintech
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Truelogic

At Truelogic we are a leading provider of nearshore staff augmentation services headquartered in New York. For over two decades, we’ve been delivering top-tier technology solutions to companies of all sizes, from innovative startups to industry leaders, helping them achieve their digital transformation goals.

Our team of 600+ highly skilled tech professionals, based in Latin America, drives digital disruption by partnering with U.S. companies on their most impactful projects. Whether collaborating with Fortune 500 giants or scaling startups, we deliver results that make a difference.

By applying for this position, you’re taking the first step in joining a dynamic team that values your expertise and aspirations. We aim to align your skills with opportunities that foster exceptional career growth and success while contributing to transformative projects that shape the future.

Our Client

A mission-first financial service provider dedicated to helping under-served customers in emerging markets to achieve financial stability and success. Lending through a patented technology that turns a smartphone into digital collateral and cutting-edge machine learning, data science, and anti-fraud AI allow them to offer the lowest cost and qualify the most customers in the industry. As of 2024, we have brought billions of dollars in credit to 12 million customers, doubling in the last two years while remaining strongly profitable and sustainable for the long term.


Job Summary

As a Software Engineer, you will build the technology to support millions of customers worldwide. Our unique locking technology combines our proprietary “secret sauce” and the effective use of data to give users credit-based products in emerging markets. We're also focused on world-class app design, web frontend and backend, and partner API integrations. As a key part of the global engineering team, you need to be up for any technical challenge and willing to learn new technologies.

Responsibilities

  • Code software primarily in PHP, Javascript/Vue/AngularJS, HTML, and CSS. Design, implement, test, debug, and deploy features and services from product specifications. Work with the Product team to deliver code that addresses business needs.

  • Use and manage relational SQL databases. Use SQL programming language to perform Create, Retrieve, Update, and Delete operations (DDL and DML commands). Design and implement database schema changes to support new features.

  • Understand the importance of customer data. Proper handling of customer’s sensitive information. Build data-driven products

  • Work with global engineering teams and partners to deliver great products into international markets. Design and implement tools to guarantee that remote teams are able to support partners’ needs. Build APIs to deliver the data partners need in real-time.

  • Build independently and/or take ownership of sets of features. Contribute to feature development across the full life-cycle: requirements to implementation, requirement changes, follow-up implementation, and bug fixes.

  • Grow the engineering team. Provide mentorship and documentation for new engineers. Interview new candidates for the team

  • Be willing to work in a collaborative environment. Participate in code reviews as an important part of the job. Be able to work collaboratively with other engineers using engineering practices but not limited to, pair programming and TDD. Willing to work in an Agile environment.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • Preferably experience in financial technology services.

  • 5+ years of experience working in full-stack development with PHP, Javascript, Vue, Angular, HTML, and CSS.

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with constant requirement changes.

  • Proficient in designing and building RESTful services and APIs

  • Proficient in database schema design (Relational DBs, MYSQL, Postgres)

  • Good understanding of integration with 3rd party payment providers

  • Good understanding of data streaming solutions (ex: Kafka)

  • Solid understanding of caching solutions (ex: Memcache, Redis)

  • Solid understanding of scheduling solutions (ex: Celery)

  • Knowledge of GraphQL is a plus.

What We Offer

  • 100% Company-funded Health and Dental insurance for employees and immediate family members.

  • Life insurance.

  • Phone finance, headphones, home office equipment, and fitness perks.

  • 30 days of Christmas bonus

  • 20 days paid Vacation

  • 50% Vacation premium

  • 13% Saving funds

  • $2,000 MXN monthly grocery coupons

  • $2,000 USD annual Co-working Travel perk

  • $2,000 USD annual Professional Development perk

Extra Info

It's required to go to the office in Col. Cuauhtémoc (CDMX), 3 times per week.

Apply now!

Our Client

A B2B digital marketing agency that helps associations and businesses reach, engage, and grow their key audiences. It combines media expertise with first-party audience data to maximize brand reach and revenue potential.


Job Summary

The role involves developing a new system designed to streamline and optimize the management of advertisers, campaigns, and ad groups across multiple advertising platforms and ad servers. The position focuses on building scalable, secure, and maintainable backend services that will power the next generation of ad management and reporting tools. The ideal candidate will work closely with cross-functional teams to design efficient architectures, ensure data integrity and system performance, and contribute to a robust, future-ready digital advertising ecosystem

Responsibilities

  • Design and implement backend services and Web APIs following OpenAPI (Swagger) standards, ensuring scalability and maintainability.

  • Develop efficient, modular, and testable code using C# .NET 6+ and Entity Framework (code-first), applying Dependency Injection and interface-based programming principles.

  • Design and optimize SQL Server data models and queries, ensuring high performance and data integrity.

  • Deploy and maintain cloud services in Microsoft Azure, leveraging PaaS solutions and integrating secure authentication via Okta or similar Identity Providers.

  • Collaborate within an Agile (Scrum) environment, managing CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps and ensuring quality through unit and integration testing.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience developing backend systems with C#/.NET 6 or higher, including building and documenting RESTful APIs using Swagger/OpenAPI.

  • Proficiency in SQL Server and Entity Framework (Code-First Migrations), with experience optimizing queries and database performance.

  • Hands-on experience deploying and maintaining cloud services in Azure, managing CI/CD pipelines and version control through Azure DevOps.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Truelogic

At Truelogic we are a leading provider of nearshore staff augmentation services headquartered in New York. For over two decades, we’ve been delivering top-tier technology solutions to companies of all sizes, from innovative startups to industry leaders, helping them achieve their digital transformation goals.

Our team of 600+ highly skilled tech professionals, based in Latin America, drives digital disruption by partnering with U.S. companies on their most impactful projects. Whether collaborating with Fortune 500 giants or scaling startups, we deliver results that make a difference.

By applying for this position, you’re taking the first step in joining a dynamic team that values your expertise and aspirations. We aim to align your skills with opportunities that foster exceptional career growth and success while contributing to transformative projects that shape the future.

Our Client

A technology company leading the development of a next-generation digital Crypto Bank for a confidential client headquartered in Abu Dhabi. The initiative combines enterprise-grade banking systems with blockchain integration, enabling secure, scalable, and modular financial operations across global markets.

The platform aims to serve as a secure digital banking backbone, supporting real-world transactions, digital asset custody, and blockchain interoperability — with strict architectural and compliance standards aligned to the financial industry.

The system will integrate with third-party providers such as payment rails and KYC services, and there is no legacy or existing banking backend, but there will be future integrations with external banking services.
Job Summary

Looking for competent Staff Back-End Engineers to design and build the platform’s core modules.

These engineers will play a foundational role in creating a secure, scalable, and modular banking infrastructure that manages real financial transactions and workflows. But there is an essential requirement for deep experience in cryptocurrency technologies.

This engineer will own the module responsible for integrating crypto-specific functionalities, ensuring the digital bank’s bridge to blockchain infrastructure is reliable and secure.

Responsibilities

  • Design, document, and implement end-to-end backend modules in Golang.

  • Define and propose an architecture for the assigned module(s); present and align designs with the CTO and peer engineers.

  • Integrate individual modules to ensure architectural consistency across the whole platform.

  • Develop systems with strong workflow and state management for key entities (e.g., payments, transactions).

  • Implement and manage transactional logic, ensuring consistency, durability, and fault tolerance across distributed systems.

  • Work with workflow/transaction management frameworks such as Temporal (or similar).

  • Build RESTful and service-based architectures that can integrate seamlessly with enterprise systems.

  • Collaborate with peers to align on standards, APIs, and design decisions.

  • Uphold a design-first mindset—prototyping and iteration occur after architectural alignment, not as trial-and-error coding.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

Our Client

This client believes that as customers move online, brand coverage, social media presence, and overall lifestyle affinity win the day. Now brands of any size can expand their reach to a national or international stage.


Job Summary

We're seeking a high-level Meta Ads Specialist to lead the advertising strategy for a new global ecommerce venture focused on D2C home decor for European football fans. You will be responsible for designing and executing Meta (Facebook + Instagram) ad campaigns using AI-enhanced targeting, optimized for conversion across highly passionate, remote fanbases.

This is a hands-on role. You will operate initially as a contributor reporting to the head of the 2-person area while laying the groundwork to grow and lead a team in the near future. Strong management skills are a must, even if the current team is a team of one.

Responsibilities

  • Set up and manage Meta ad campaigns focused on ROAS.

  • Use Meta's AI tools to hyper-target niche audiences.

  • Run simulations to test reach and ad performance across multiple regions.

  • Provide reports, insights, and ad spend guidance to strategic leadership.

  • Collaborate with content and product teams to align on ad creatives and assets.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • 5+ years of Meta Ads experience.

  • Deep understanding of Meta's evolving AI-based targeting tools.

  • Experience in e-commerce and/or D2C campaigns.

  • Self-starter capable of building, executing, and optimizing solo.

  • Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.

  • Bonus: Experience targeting audiences in Europe, LATAM, and Asia.

The system will integrate with third-party providers such as payment rails and KYC services, and there is no legacy or existing banking backend, but there will be future integrations with external banking services.


Job Summary

Looking for competent Staff Back-End Engineers to design and build the platform’s core modules.

These engineers will play a foundational role in creating a secure, scalable, and modular banking infrastructure that manages real financial transactions and workflows. But there is an essential requirement for deep experience in cryptocurrency technologies.

This engineer will own the module responsible for integrating crypto-specific functionalities, ensuring the digital bank’s bridge to blockchain infrastructure is reliable and secure.

Responsibilities

  • Design, document, and implement end-to-end backend modules in Golang.

  • Define and propose an architecture for the assigned module(s); present and align designs with the CTO and peer engineers.

  • Integrate individual modules to ensure architectural consistency across the whole platform.

  • Develop systems with strong workflow and state management for key entities (e.g., payments, transactions).

  • Implement and manage transactional logic, ensuring consistency, durability, and fault tolerance across distributed systems.

  • Work with workflow/transaction management frameworks such as Temporal (or similar).

  • Build RESTful and service-based architectures that can integrate seamlessly with enterprise systems.

  • Collaborate with peers to align on standards, APIs, and design decisions.

  • Uphold a design-first mindset—prototyping and iteration occur after architectural alignment, not as trial-and-error coding.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • Understanding of digital asset custody, wallets, and transaction flows.

  • Familiarity with smart contracts and blockchain transaction management.

  • Ability to bridge between traditional banking workflows and blockchain-based systems.

  • Strong proficiency in Golang.

  • Demonstrated experience with Workflow Management, State Management, and Transaction Management systems.

  • Hands-on experience integrating with enterprise software systems (multi-service, multi-architecture environments).

At Truelogic we are a leading provider of nearshore staff augmentation services headquartered in New York. For over two decades, we’ve been delivering top-tier technology solutions to companies of all sizes, from innovative startups to industry leaders, helping them achieve their digital transformation goals.

Our team of 600+ highly skilled tech professionals, based in Latin America, drives digital disruption by partnering with U.S. companies on their most impactful projects. Whether collaborating with Fortune 500 giants or scaling startups, we deliver results that make a difference.

By applying for this position, you’re taking the first step in joining a dynamic team that values your expertise and aspirations. We aim to align your skills with opportunities that foster exceptional career growth and success while contributing to transformative projects that shape the future.


OUR CLIENT

A leading provider of sales intelligence solutions helping businesses accelerate growth through data-driven insights.



JOB SUMMARY

We’re looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join the enterprise data engineering team. You’ll play a key role in building and optimizing data pipelines, designing scalable data solutions, and enabling advanced analytics across the organization. This is a high-impact role where you’ll work closely with engineers, analysts, and data scientists to ensure data is accurate, reliable, and accessible.


RESPONSIBILITIES

 - Build and continuously improve data gathering, modeling, and reporting capabilities.

 - Design and maintain data pipelines and ETL workflows to ensure efficient processing of large datasets.

 - Collaborate with cross-functional teams (engineers, analysts, product owners, scientists) to identify and meet data needs.

 - Develop and maintain data warehouse solutions, ensuring performance and scalability.

 - Implement quality checks and enforce data governance best practices.

 - Contribute to the self-service data platform and empower teams with accessible data.


QUALIFICATIONS AND JOB REQUIREMENTS

 - 8+ years of experience as a Data/BI Engineer.

 - Strong SQL skills with hands-on experience in SQL and NoSQL databases.

 - Proven experience with Snowflake (highly desirable), Redshift, or BigQuery.

 - Experience developing pipelines with Airflow or equivalent orchestration software.

 - Proficiency in Python (notebooks and data processing).

 - Hands-on experience with DBT for data modeling and transformations.

 - Experience with AWS or GCP services (e.g., S3/GCS, Lambda/Cloud Functions, EMR/Dataproc, Glue/Dataflow, Athena).

 - Strong understanding of data cleaning, transformation, and ETL design.

 - Experience implementing data quality checks and monitoring.

 - Strong and clear communication skills.


WHAT WE OFFER

 - 100% Remote Work: Enjoy the freedom to work from the location that helps you thrive. All it takes is a laptop and a reliable internet connection.

 - Highly Competitive USD Pay: Earn an excellent, market-leading compensation in USD, that goes beyond typical market offerings.

 - Paid Time Off: We value your well-being. Our paid time off policies ensure you have the chance to unwind and recharge when needed.

 - Work with Autonomy: Enjoy the freedom to manage your time as long as the work gets done. Focus on results, not the clock.

 - Work with Top American Companies: Grow your expertise working on innovative, high-impact projects with Industry-Leading U.S. Companies.


WHY YOU’LL LIKE WORKING HERE

 - A Culture That Values You: We prioritize well-being and work-life balance, offering engagement activities and fostering dynamic teams to ensure you thrive both personally and professionally.

 - Diverse, Global Network: Connect with over 600 professionals in 25+ countries, expand your network, and collaborate with a multicultural team from Latin America.

 - Team Up with Skilled Professionals: Join forces with senior talent. All of our team members are seasoned experts, ensuring you're working with the best in your field.

Apply now!

The ideal candidate will bridge the gap between business and technology teams, gathering requirements, defining product roadmaps, and ensuring the successful implementation of Adobe solutions to drive digital transformation. This role requires strong analytical skills, a deep understanding of marketing technology, and experience working with cross-functional teams to deliver scalable and innovative solutions.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define and prioritize business requirements for Adobe Experience Cloud solutions.

  • Develop and maintain product roadmaps, ensuring alignment with business objectives and user needs.

  • Act as the primary liaison between business users, technical teams, and Adobe consultants to drive solution design and implementation.

  • Define and document business processes, user stories, acceptance criteria, and functional specifications.

  • Oversee the end-to-end implementation of Adobe solutions, ensuring seamless integration across AEM, AEP CDP, CJA, Workfront, Analytics, and Target.

  • Support change management efforts, user adoption, and training to maximize the value of Adobe Experience Cloud products.

  • Ensure compliance with best practices, governance policies, and industry standards for data security and privacy.

  • Facilitate workshops, sprint planning, and backlog grooming sessions with agile development teams.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • Strong understanding of AEM (Adobe Experience Manager) and Workfront.

  • Experience defining and managing digital marketing and content strategies within enterprise environments.

  • Hands-on experience gathering requirements, writing user stories, and managing product backlogs.

  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills to align business and technical teams.

  • Understanding of Agile and Scrum methodologies in a digital marketing or enterprise setting.

  • 7–10 years of experience in business analysis, product ownership, or digital marketing technology roles.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Truelogic

At Truelogic we are a leading provider of nearshore staff augmentation services headquartered in New York. For over two decades, we’ve been delivering top-tier technology solutions to companies of all sizes, from innovative startups to industry leaders, helping them achieve their digital transformation goals.

Our team of 600+ highly skilled tech professionals, based in Latin America, drives digital disruption by partnering with U.S. companies on their most impactful projects. Whether collaborating with Fortune 500 giants or scaling startups, we deliver results that make a difference.

By applying for this position, you’re taking the first step in joining a dynamic team that values your expertise and aspirations. We aim to align your skills with opportunities that foster exceptional career growth and success while contributing to transformative projects that shape the future.

Our Client

A global leader in go-to-market intelligence, providing real-time business data, insights, and technology to tens of thousands of companies worldwide. Known for its expertise in sales and marketing enablement, data accuracy, and privacy-first practices, the company empowers organizations to discover, engage, and grow their customer base more effectively. With industry-leading compliance standards, a comprehensive product ecosystem, and a reputation for innovation, this organization helps businesses streamline their tech stacks, align teams, and accelerate revenue growth.


Job Summary

We are seeking an experienced Data Platform Engineer to enhance and optimize our enterprise-scale metadata management environment built on OpenMetadata. This role will focus on extending platform functionality, improving ingestion pipelines, enhancing data lineage capture, and integrating with a modern data stack that includes Airflow, RDS, and OpenSearch. You will be responsible for backend feature development, scalability improvements, and system reliability, with a heavy emphasis on automation and custom integration work. This is a highly collaborative role that requires close work with platform engineers, while taking full ownership of feature development and operational stability for the metadata platform.

Responsibilities

  • Design, build, and maintain custom OpenMetadata connectors for metadata ingestion.

  • Extend and automate data lineage capture from multiple systems and repositories.

  • Debug, patch, and enhance backend features to improve stability and scalability.

  • Manage containerized deployments (Kubernetes/ECS) and implement monitoring solutions.

  • Optimize storage and retrieval using RDS (PostgreSQL/MySQL) and OpenSearch/Elasticsearch.

  • Orchestrate metadata workflows with Apache Airflow and integrate with existing pipelines.

  • Implement and maintain RBAC with Okta, supporting clear role separation.

  • Oversee upgrade management, backup strategies, and high-availability configurations.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • 5+ years in data engineering or platform engineering roles, with hands-on OpenMetadata experience.

  • Proficiency in ECS (AWS), Airflow, RDS, and OpenSearch/Elasticsearch.

  • Strong Python development skills for API integrations and connector development.

  • Proven experience implementing RBAC and identity management integrations (e.g., Okta).

  • Skilled in container orchestration, infrastructure automation, and performance optimization.

  • Ability to merge and manage open-source updates into customized codebases.

  • Strong problem-solving skills and a track record of delivering production-grade, scalable solutions.

What We Offer

  • 100% Remote Work: Enjoy the freedom to work from the location that helps you thrive. All it takes is a laptop and a reliable internet connection.

At Truelogic we are a leading provider of nearshore staff augmentation services headquartered in New York. For over two decades, we’ve been delivering top-tier technology solutions to companies of all sizes, from innovative startups to industry leaders, helping them achieve their digital transformation goals.

Our team of 600+ highly skilled tech professionals, based in Latin America, drives digital disruption by partnering with U.S. companies on their most impactful projects. Whether collaborating with Fortune 500 giants or scaling startups, we deliver results that make a difference.

By applying for this position, you’re taking the first step in joining a dynamic team that values your expertise and aspirations. We aim to align your skills with opportunities that foster exceptional career growth and success while contributing to transformative projects that shape the future.


OUR CLIENT

Leader in pediatric and family mental health, offering coaching, therapy, prescriptions, and intensive outpatient care. The company is preparing for major launches in collaboration with Lyra, including a 1-1 shared service, and is expanding its engineering capacity to support growth.



JOB SUMMARY

We are seeking a Tech Lead / Engineering Manager who is both hands-on and able to manage a small team. This person will be the primary point of contact, lead technical execution, and help scale the team. They will also actively write code while managing and mentoring two senior engineers.


RESPONSIBILITIES

 - Lead and manage a small engineering squad (2 Full-Stack Engineers).

 - Write production-quality code alongside the team.

 - Own backend (Ruby) and frontend (React + TypeScript) development.

 - Collaborate with the Product team to refine requirements and tickets.

 - Drive the adoption of automation and ensure high-quality deliverables.

 - Act as the primary interface with Bend Health leadership.


QUALIFICATIONS AND JOB REQUIREMENTS

 - 7+ years of software engineering experience.

 - Strong background in Ruby (backend).

 - Proficiency in React + TypeScript (frontend).

 - Experience with AWS, Postgres, Kubernetes.

 - Familiarity with end-to-end automation (Playwright preferred).

 - Proven experience managing and mentoring engineers.

 - Startup mindset: proactive, low ego, collaborative, business-aware.

 - Comfortable wearing multiple hats and thinking beyond tickets.


WHAT WE OFFER

 - 100% Remote Work: Enjoy the freedom to work from the location that helps you thrive. All it takes is a laptop and a reliable internet connection.

 - Highly Competitive USD Pay: Earn an excellent, market-leading compensation in USD, that goes beyond typical market offerings.

 - Paid Time Off: We value your well-being. Our paid time off policies ensure you have the chance to unwind and recharge when needed.

 - Work with Autonomy: Enjoy the freedom to manage your time as long as the work gets done. Focus on results, not the clock.

 - Work with Top American Companies: Grow your expertise working on innovative, high-impact projects with Industry-Leading U.S. Companies.


WHY YOU’LL LIKE WORKING HERE

 - A Culture That Values You: We prioritize well-being and work-life balance, offering engagement activities and fostering dynamic teams to ensure you thrive both personally and professionally.

 - Diverse, Global Network: Connect with over 600 professionals in 25+ countries, expand your network, and collaborate with a multicultural team from Latin America.

 - Team Up with Skilled Professionals: Join forces with senior talent. All of our team members are seasoned experts, ensuring you're working with the best in your field.

Apply now!

jobs.title: Senior Data Platform Engineer (OpenMetadata) - GTM Data Leader | Brazil
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Truelogic

At Truelogic we are a leading provider of nearshore staff augmentation services headquartered in New York. For over two decades, we’ve been delivering top-tier technology solutions to companies of all sizes, from innovative startups to industry leaders, helping them achieve their digital transformation goals.

Our team of 600+ highly skilled tech professionals, based in Latin America, drives digital disruption by partnering with U.S. companies on their most impactful projects. Whether collaborating with Fortune 500 giants or scaling startups, we deliver results that make a difference.

By applying for this position, you’re taking the first step in joining a dynamic team that values your expertise and aspirations. We aim to align your skills with opportunities that foster exceptional career growth and success while contributing to transformative projects that shape the future.

Our Client

A global leader in go-to-market intelligence, providing real-time business data, insights, and technology to tens of thousands of companies worldwide. Known for its expertise in sales and marketing enablement, data accuracy, and privacy-first practices, the company empowers organizations to discover, engage, and grow their customer base more effectively. With industry-leading compliance standards, a comprehensive product ecosystem, and a reputation for innovation, this organization helps businesses streamline their tech stacks, align teams, and accelerate revenue growth.


Job Summary

We are seeking an experienced Data Platform Engineer to enhance and optimize our enterprise-scale metadata management environment built on OpenMetadata. This role will focus on extending platform functionality, improving ingestion pipelines, enhancing data lineage capture, and integrating with a modern data stack that includes Airflow, RDS, and OpenSearch. You will be responsible for backend feature development, scalability improvements, and system reliability, with a heavy emphasis on automation and custom integration work. This is a highly collaborative role that requires close work with platform engineers, while taking full ownership of feature development and operational stability for the metadata platform.

Responsibilities

  • Design, build, and maintain custom OpenMetadata connectors for metadata ingestion.

  • Extend and automate data lineage capture from multiple systems and repositories.

  • Debug, patch, and enhance backend features to improve stability and scalability.

  • Manage containerized deployments (Kubernetes/ECS) and implement monitoring solutions.

  • Optimize storage and retrieval using RDS (PostgreSQL/MySQL) and OpenSearch/Elasticsearch.

  • Orchestrate metadata workflows with Apache Airflow and integrate with existing pipelines.

  • Implement and maintain RBAC with Okta, supporting clear role separation.

  • Oversee upgrade management, backup strategies, and high-availability configurations.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • 5+ years in data engineering or platform engineering roles, with hands-on OpenMetadata experience.

  • Proficiency in ECS (AWS), Airflow, RDS, and OpenSearch/Elasticsearch.

  • Strong Python development skills for API integrations and connector development.

  • Proven experience implementing RBAC and identity management integrations (e.g., Okta).

  • Skilled in container orchestration, infrastructure automation, and performance optimization.

  • Ability to merge and manage open-source updates into customized codebases.

  • Strong problem-solving skills and a track record of delivering production-grade, scalable solutions.

What We Offer

  • 100% Remote Work: Enjoy the freedom to work from the location that helps you thrive. All it takes is a laptop and a reliable internet connection.

  • Highly Competitive USD Pay: Earn an excellent, market-leading compensation in USD, that goes beyond typical market offerings.

  • Paid Time Off: We value your well-being. Our paid time off policies ensure you have the chance to unwind and recharge when needed.

  • Work with Autonomy: Enjoy the freedom to manage your time as long as the work gets done. Focus on results, not the clock.

  • Work with Top American Companies: Grow your expertise working on innovative, high-impact projects with Industry-Leading U.S. Companies.

Why You’ll Like Working Here

  • A Culture That Values You: We prioritize well-being and work-life balance, offering engagement activities and fostering dynamic teams to ensure you thrive both personally and professionally.

  • Diverse, Global Network: Connect with over 600 professionals in 25+ countries, expand your network, and collaborate with a multicultural team from Latin America.

  • Team Up with Skilled Professionals: Join forces with senior talent. All of our team members are seasoned experts, ensuring you're working with the best in your field.

Apply now!

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Truelogic

At Truelogic we are a leading provider of nearshore staff augmentation services headquartered in New York. For over two decades, we’ve been delivering top-tier technology solutions to companies of all sizes, from innovative startups to industry leaders, helping them achieve their digital transformation goals.

Our team of 600+ highly skilled tech professionals, based in Latin America, drives digital disruption by partnering with U.S. companies on their most impactful projects. Whether collaborating with Fortune 500 giants or scaling startups, we deliver results that make a difference.

By applying for this position, you’re taking the first step in joining a dynamic team that values your expertise and aspirations. We aim to align your skills with opportunities that foster exceptional career growth and success while contributing to transformative projects that shape the future.

Our Client

Our client is a technology-first creative network that blends equal parts engineering expertise and creative vision to solve complex business challenges. With a global footprint and a portfolio of leading agencies under its umbrella, they partner with some of the world’s most recognized brands across industries to craft innovative, high-impact digital experiences. Their multidisciplinary teams leverage emerging technologies, AI, and deep market insights to deliver solutions that drive performance, engagement, and transformation.


Job Summary

The AI Engineer will play a pivotal role in designing, developing, and deploying AI-powered solutions that enhance immersive, high-performance web experiences for global clients. This position combines hands-on technical work with strategic solution design, requiring expertise in machine learning algorithms, data processing, and AI infrastructure. The ideal candidate will be a collaborative problem solver, adept at translating business goals into scalable AI architectures while ensuring performance, security, and accessibility.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify AI opportunities, gather requirements, and architect end-to-end solutions.

  • Design, develop, and implement machine learning and deep learning models using frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, and LLM-oriented tools.

  • Build and deploy AI agents using LangChain (or equivalent frameworks) for agentic development.

  • Oversee data collection, preprocessing, and feature engineering for high-quality model inputs.

  • Train, fine-tune, and evaluate models — including large language models (LLMs) — using large datasets and appropriate performance metrics.

  • Select, configure, and optimize AI infrastructure, tools, and frameworks on Google Cloud Platform (GCP), with additional exposure to AWS and Azure.

  • Ensure scalability, security, and efficiency in cloud-based AI solutions.

  • Build prototypes and proof of concepts (POCs) to validate feasibility and potential impact.

  • Provide technical leadership and mentorship to AI development teams.

  • Stay informed on emerging AI trends and technologies, contributing innovative ideas to the company’s AI strategy.

  • Lead deployment of AI solutions into production, ensuring seamless integration with existing systems.

  • Ensure compliance with HIPAA and best practices for handling PII in AI-driven systems.

  • Continuously optimize AI systems for performance, reliability, and accuracy.

  • Produce clear and comprehensive technical documentation.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • Proven track record as an AI Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, Data Engineer, or AI Architect.

  • Strong programming skills in Python, with hands-on experience in LangChain (or similar frameworks) for agentic/LLM-based development.

  • Deep understanding of machine learning techniques, algorithms, and model evaluation methods.

  • Experience working with large language models (LLMs), fine-tuning, and deploying them at scale.

  • Expertise with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), plus exposure to AWS and Azure.

  • Familiarity with big data technologies, data processing pipelines, and distributed computing.

  • Knowledge of compliance requirements such as HIPAA and best practices for handling PII data.

  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

  • Strong communication skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.

  • Demonstrated ability to lead technical initiatives, drive innovation, and mentor junior team members.

What We Offer

  • 100% Remote Work: Enjoy the freedom to work from the location that helps you thrive. All it takes is a laptop and a reliable internet connection.

  • Highly Competitive USD Pay: Earn an excellent, market-leading compensation in USD, that goes beyond typical market offerings.

  • Paid Time Off: We value your well-being. Our paid time off policies ensure you have the chance to unwind and recharge when needed.

  • Work with Autonomy: Enjoy the freedom to manage your time as long as the work gets done. Focus on results, not the clock.

  • Work with Top American Companies: Grow your expertise working on innovative, high-impact projects with Industry-Leading U.S. Companies.

Why You’ll Like Working Here

  • Diverse, Global Network: Connect with over 600 professionals in 25+ countries, expand your network, and collaborate with a multicultural team from Latin America.

  • Team Up with Skilled Professionals: Join forces with senior talent. All of our team members are seasoned experts, ensuring you're working with the best in your field.

  • Strategic Thinking: Ability to identify bottlenecks or untapped opportunities in our data workflows and propose scalable, long-term solutions.

  • 6+ years of experience in data engineering with a strong focus on AWS environments.

  • Proficiency in Redshift and data warehouse performance tuning.

  • Hands-on experience with Airflow or other orchestration frameworks.

  • Expertise in SQL, Python, and data modeling.

  • Experience with dbt and modular data modeling.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Truelogic

At Truelogic we are a leading provider of nearshore staff augmentation services headquartered in New York. For over two decades, we’ve been delivering top-tier technology solutions to companies of all sizes, from innovative startups to industry leaders, helping them achieve their digital transformation goals.

Our team of 600+ highly skilled tech professionals, based in Latin America, drives digital disruption by partnering with U.S. companies on their most impactful projects. Whether collaborating with Fortune 500 giants or scaling startups, we deliver results that make a difference.

By applying for this position, you’re taking the first step in joining a dynamic team that values your expertise and aspirations. We aim to align your skills with opportunities that foster exceptional career growth and success while contributing to transformative projects that shape the future.

Our Client

The are a veterinary software company that helps practices enhance patient care, improve staff efficiency, and minimize burnout. We were founded in 2017 and are a mid-size company (50-100 people) that has used Elixir from the start. Our back-end runs fully in Elixir with our front-end in React, with GraphQL connecting the two.


Job Summary

As a Senior AWS Data Engineer, you will be responsible for building, maintaining, and scaling our core data infrastructure across Redshift, Airflow, and AWS. You will work closely with both Platform and Product Engineering teams to ensure our data systems are secure, reliable, and easy to work with.

This role is not just about owning the pipelines. You’ll help productize our internal data services, reduce internal friction, and turn our data architecture into a key market differentiator. You will mentor others, provide strategic input on data design, and help the company move faster through better data access, quality, and observability.

Responsibilities

  • Empower Others through Reliable Data Systems.

  • Design, build, and maintain scalable ETL pipelines using Airflow, dbt, and AWS-native services.

  • Manage and optimize Redshift clusters for performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency.

  • Own the architecture and lifecycle of our core data infrastructure.

  • Lead with Purpose, Support with Context.

  • Serve as the subject matter expert on data engineering for both platform and product teams.

  • Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure data is modeled and accessible in ways that support reporting and feature development.

  • Help define data governance policies and enforce access controls across services.

  • Trust Through Transparency and Resilience.

  • Build observability and alerting into pipelines to catch issues before they impact users.

  • Implement monitoring and reliability tools using Datadog or similar platforms.

  • Ensure systems are designed to meet compliance and audit standards (SOC 2, HIPAA, etc.).

  • Champion Curiosity and Collaboration.

  • Partner cross-functionally to gather data requirements and translate them into scalable solutions.

  • Participate in sprint planning, design reviews, and retrospectives.

  • Mentor junior team members and promote data engineering best practices across the company

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • Data Engineering & Architecture Expertise: Deep knowledge of data warehouse design, ETL frameworks, and performance optimization within Redshift and AWS.

  • Structured Data Access & Usability: Understands how to serve data in a way that's accessible and usable for analysts, product teams, and business stakeholders.

  • Problem Solving & Innovation: Strong analytical mindset with a focus on simplifying systems and reducing long-term maintenance costs.

  • Reporting & Insight Enablement: Strong understanding of how data supports real-world decision-making. Can collaborate with analysts where needed to build reporting queries and semantic layers that streamline access to relevant data and accelerate the development of dashboards, reducing turnaround time for insights.

  • Communication & Mentorship: Proven ability to collaborate across teams, explain complex systems clearly, and support the growth of others.

These engineers will play a foundational role in creating a secure, scalable, and modular banking infrastructure that manages real financial transactions and workflows. But there is an essential requirement for deep experience in cryptocurrency technologies.

This engineer will own the module responsible for integrating crypto-specific functionalities, ensuring the digital bank’s bridge to blockchain infrastructure is reliable and secure.

  • Work with workflow/transaction management frameworks such as Temporal (or similar).

  • Collaborate with peers to align on standards, APIs, and design decisions.

  • Uphold a design-first mindset—prototyping and iteration occur after architectural alignment, not as trial-and-error coding.

Our back-end runs fully in Elixir with our front-end in React, with GraphQL connecting the two.


Job Summary

As a Senior AWS Data Engineer, you will be responsible for building, maintaining, and scaling our core data infrastructure across Redshift, Airflow, and AWS. You will work closely with both Platform and Product Engineering teams to ensure our data systems are secure, reliable, and easy to work with.

This role is not just about owning the pipelines. You’ll help productize our internal data services, reduce internal friction, and turn our data architecture into a key market differentiator. You will mentor others, provide strategic input on data design, and help the company move faster through better data access, quality, and observability.

Responsibilities

  • Empower Others through Reliable Data Systems.

  • Design, build, and maintain scalable ETL pipelines using Airflow, dbt, and AWS-native services.

  • Manage and optimize Redshift clusters for performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency.

  • Own the architecture and lifecycle of our core data infrastructure.

  • Lead with Purpose, Support with Context.

  • Serve as the subject matter expert on data engineering for both platform and product teams.

  • Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure data is modeled and accessible in ways that support reporting and feature development.

  • Help define data governance policies and enforce access controls across services.

  • Trust Through Transparency and Resilience.

  • Build observability and alerting into pipelines to catch issues before they impact users.

  • Implement monitoring and reliability tools using Datadog or similar platforms.

  • Ensure systems are designed to meet compliance and audit standards (SOC 2, HIPAA, etc.).

  • Champion Curiosity and Collaboration.

  • Partner cross-functionally to gather data requirements and translate them into scalable solutions.

  • Participate in sprint planning, design reviews, and retrospectives.

  • Mentor junior team members and promote data engineering best practices across the company

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • Data Engineering & Architecture Expertise: Deep knowledge of data warehouse design, ETL frameworks, and performance optimization within Redshift and AWS.

  • Structured Data Access & Usability: Understands how to serve data in a way that's accessible and usable for analysts, product teams, and business stakeholders.

  • Problem Solving & Innovation: Strong analytical mindset with a focus on simplifying systems and reducing long-term maintenance costs.

  • Reporting & Insight Enablement: Strong understanding of how data supports real-world decision-making. Can collaborate with analysts where needed to build reporting queries and semantic layers that streamline access to relevant data and accelerate the development of dashboards, reducing turnaround time for insights.

  • Communication & Mentorship: Proven ability to collaborate across teams, explain complex systems clearly, and support the growth of others.

  • Strategic Thinking: Ability to identify bottlenecks or untapped opportunities in our data workflows and propose scalable, long-term solutions.

  • 6+ years of experience in data engineering with a strong focus on AWS environments.

  • Proficiency in Redshift and data warehouse performance tuning.

  • Hands-on experience with Airflow or other orchestration frameworks.

  • Expertise in SQL, Python, and data modeling.

  • Experience with dbt and modular data modeling.

They are creating a fundamentally better healthcare experience for people with chronic health conditions and those who care for them. They make healthcare more accessible by simplifying complex care plans, connecting care teams, and meeting patients where they live. Through their conversational AI, patients use their voice to interact with a digital care companion that proactively provides medication reminders, symptom checks, behavioral nudges, and even engages in friendly conversations to ease loneliness.


Job Summary

We’re looking for a Senior ML/Edge Engineer to lead the development of ML models that power our physiological signal analysis. This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of machine learning, signal processing, and embedded systems — taking models from research to real-world deployment on constrained edge devices.

Responsibilities

  • Own the full ML lifecycle: data collection, cleaning, model training, evaluation, deployment.

  • Develop and optimize models for signal processing and time-series biosignals.

  • Refactor Python-based models into C/C++ for edge deployment.

  • Address resource constraints: memory, threading, concurrency, power.

  • Work closely with firmware/software teams to integrate models on-device.

  • Ensure production success: deploy, monitor drift, iterate post-launch.

  • Flexibility in profile fit: strong modelers with some C++, or strong C++ engineers with workable ML chops.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • 5+ years applied ML experience with embedded/edge deployment.

  • Strong background in signal processing and time-series data.

  • Proven ability to ship AI products into production, including drift monitoring.

  • Proficiency in Python (modeling) and C/C++ (embedded deployment).

  • Knowledge of resource-constrained systems.

  • Excellent problem-solving and communication skills; thrive in a fast-moving startup.

At Truelogic we are a leading provider of nearshore staff augmentation services headquartered in New York. For over two decades, we’ve been delivering top-tier technology solutions to companies of all sizes, from innovative startups to industry leaders, helping them achieve their digital transformation goals.

Our team of 600+ highly skilled tech professionals, based in Latin America, drives digital disruption by partnering with U.S. companies on their most impactful projects. Whether collaborating with Fortune 500 giants or scaling startups, we deliver results that make a difference.

By applying for this position, you’re taking the first step in joining a dynamic team that values your expertise and aspirations. We aim to align your skills with opportunities that foster exceptional career growth and success while contributing to transformative projects that shape the future.


OUR CLIENT

They are creating a fundamentally better healthcare experience for people with chronic health conditions and those who care for them. They make healthcare more accessible by simplifying complex care plans, connecting care teams, and meeting patients where they live. Through their conversational AI, patients use their voice to interact with a digital care companion that proactively provides medication reminders, symptom checks, behavioral nudges, and even engages in friendly conversations to ease loneliness.



JOB SUMMARY

We’re looking for a Senior ML/Edge Engineer to lead the development of ML models that power our physiological signal analysis. This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of machine learning, signal processing, and embedded systems — taking models from research to real-world deployment on constrained edge devices.


RESPONSIBILITIES

 - Own the full ML lifecycle: data collection, cleaning, model training, evaluation, deployment.

 - Develop and optimize models for signal processing and time-series biosignals.

 - Refactor Python-based models into C/C++ for edge deployment.

 - Address resource constraints: memory, threading, concurrency, power.

 - Work closely with firmware/software teams to integrate models on-device.

 - Ensure production success: deploy, monitor drift, iterate post-launch.

 - Flexibility in profile fit: strong modelers with some C++, or strong C++ engineers with workable ML chops.


QUALIFICATIONS AND JOB REQUIREMENTS

 - 5+ years applied ML experience with embedded/edge deployment.

 - Strong background in signal processing and time-series data.

 - Proven ability to ship AI products into production, including drift monitoring.

 - Proficiency in Python (modeling) and C/C++ (embedded deployment).

 - Knowledge of resource-constrained systems.

 - Excellent problem-solving and communication skills; thrive in a fast-moving startup.


WHAT WE OFFER

 - 100% Remote Work: Enjoy the freedom to work from the location that helps you thrive. All it takes is a laptop and a reliable internet connection.

 - Highly Competitive USD Pay: Earn an excellent, market-leading compensation in USD, that goes beyond typical market offerings.

 - Paid Time Off: We value your well-being. Our paid time off policies ensure you have the chance to unwind and recharge when needed.

 - Work with Autonomy: Enjoy the freedom to manage your time as long as the work gets done. Focus on results, not the clock.

 - Work with Top American Companies: Grow your expertise working on innovative, high-impact projects with Industry-Leading U.S. Companies.


WHY YOU’LL LIKE WORKING HERE

 - A Culture That Values You: We prioritize well-being and work-life balance, offering engagement activities and fostering dynamic teams to ensure you thrive both personally and professionally.

 - Diverse, Global Network: Connect with over 600 professionals in 25+ countries, expand your network, and collaborate with a multicultural team from Latin America.

 - Team Up with Skilled Professionals: Join forces with senior talent. All of our team members are seasoned experts, ensuring you're working with the best in your field.

Apply now!

We are a technology-enabled company providing flexible financing solutions to small and medium-sized businesses. Since 2008, we have supported over 55,000 merchants across the U.S., delivering more than $4 billion in capital for a wide range of needs—from covering operating expenses and managing cash flow gaps to fueling business growth. By leveraging proprietary technology, we streamline the funding process so that businesses can access capital in as little as 24 hours, compared to the weeks or even months it typically takes to secure a traditional bank loan.


Job Summary

We are looking for experienced developers to join our Agile team and help expand our FinTech software. You’ll have the chance to share your ideas, make a real impact, and enjoy a high level of autonomy.

Our environment runs on Azure Cloud, and we work with modern technologies such as .NET, C#, SQL Server, and Angular. Developers here are truly full stack, contributing across backend, frontend, databases, and DevOps.

Responsibilities

  • Entire environment built and hosted on Azure Cloud

  • Work with Visual Studio, Azure DevOps, C#, .NET Core, .NET Framework, Azure API Gateway, SQL Server, Angular, and more.

  • Developers are truly full stack, working across database, frontend, backend, and DevOps

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • Senior Software Engineer 6+ years’ experience.

  • Independently write well designed, testable code.

  • Implement and maintain integrations with external APIs to enhance the core platform.

  • Participate in daily standups and Agile Ceremonies

  • Participate in code reviews.

  • Significant C# and .NET Core microservices development experience

  • Thorough understanding of SOLID principles, especially IOC and SRP

  • Proficiency with automated unit and integration testing

  • Solid command of HTML, CSS and JavaScript and preferably Angular

  • In depth knowledge of relational databases ( SQL Server,MySQL, Postgres, etc)

Responsibilities

  • Model content with ACF Pro (repeaters, options pages, field validation) and wire to theme views.

  • Build responsive sections (Hero, card grids, accordions, tabs, sliders, forms) with keyboard/focus support.

  • Translate annotated Figma into production-ready HTML/CSS/JS

  • Enforce accessibility (WCAG 2.0 AA best-effort) Semantic structure, focus order, ARIA where appropriate, reduced-motion fallbacks.

  • Integrate Gravity Forms (Validation, Basic Styling) and ensure GTM/GA4 events fire correctly.

  • Collaborate with QA on cross-browser/device compliance; fix defects and regressions quickly.

  • Contribute to a lightweight design system: tokens, spacing/typography scale, utilities, and documentation.

  • Participate in code reviews, follow branching and CI conventions, and keep work visible in tickets.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • 5+ years building custom WordPress themes

  • Expert in semantic HTML, modern CSS (Grid/Flex, custom properties), and vanilla JS/TypeScript.

  • Strong ACF Pro experience (repeaters, options pages, data modeling).

  • Proven accessibility chops (focus management, ARIA patterns for accordions/tabs/menus).

  • Responsive and cross-browser development (desktop + iOS/Android modern devices).

  • Performance hygiene: images/srcset, lazy, avoiding layout shift, practical Lighthouse fixes.

Our Client

A fast-growing digital health innovator using AI, radar sensing, and cloud-native infrastructure to transform chronic care management. Their platform empowers patients and care teams through conversational AI, passive health monitoring, and timely clinical interventions that improve outcomes and reduce costs.


Job Summary

We’re seeking a Senior DevOps Engineer to join a world-class engineering team working at the intersection of AI, healthcare, and embedded systems. This critical role will design, secure, and automate the infrastructure powering LLM-backed digital health companions and radar-enabled monitoring devices. The position is full-time, based in the U.S., with the expectation of being in-office 4 days per week. The ideal candidate is an AWS expert with deep experience in Kubernetes, CI/CD automation, IaC practices, and production reliability, paired with excellent communication skills and a strong ownership mindset.

Responsibilities

  • Lead the design, implementation, and operation of cloud infrastructure for scalable, secure, and highly available services.

  • Own and optimize CI/CD pipelines for seamless deployments across environments.

  • Monitor and tune production systems for uptime, reliability, and cost efficiency using observability tools.

  • Collaborate with software and hardware engineers to support radar sensing, LLM workloads, and real-time communication.

  • Design and enforce Infrastructure-as-Code practices with Terraform, Helm, or similar tools.

  • Manage Kubernetes clusters (AWS EKS), including deployments, scaling, upgrades, and debugging.

  • Implement automated monitoring, alerting, and remediation workflows.

  • Ensure infrastructure security and compliance through IAM best practices, audits, and secrets management.

  • Troubleshoot and diagnose issues across distributed systems and services.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent practical experience).

  • 7+ years in DevOps, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE), or infrastructure engineering.

  • Expert-level AWS experience (EC2, S3, RDS, EKS, ECS, IAM, VPC, CloudWatch).

  • Strong experience with Kubernetes and Docker for container orchestration.

  • Proficiency with Infrastructure-as-Code tools (Terraform, Pulumi, AWS CDK).

  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, CircleCI, Jenkins).

  • Familiarity with observability/monitoring (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK/EFK, Datadog).

  • Skilled in scripting and automation (Python, Bash, or Go).

  • Deep knowledge of Linux administration, networking, and security best practices.

  • Excellent debugging, problem-solving, and cross-team collaboration skills.

  • Strong verbal communication and ability to work in Agile environments.

What They Offer

  • Full-Time Employment (FTE) in the U.S.

  • Comprehensive healthcare coverage (medical, dental, vision).

  • 401(k) retirement plan.

  • Office-based culture with 4 days per week onsite.

  • Opportunity to work at the cutting edge of AI, healthcare, and embedded systems with a mission-driven team.

Why You’ll Like Working Here

  • A Culture That Values You: We prioritize well-being and work-life balance, offering engagement activities and fostering dynamic teams to ensure you thrive both personally and professionally.

  • Diverse, Global Network: Connect with over 600 professionals in 25+ countries, expand your network, and collaborate with a multicultural team from Latin America.

  • Team Up with Skilled Professionals: Join forces with senior talent. All of our team members are seasoned experts, ensuring you're working with the best in your field.

Apply now!

Close collaboration with developers, product managers, and business stakeholders is essential to align testing efforts with business objectives, accelerate release cycles, and deliver a seamless consumer experience.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Truelogic

At Truelogic we are a leading provider of nearshore staff augmentation services headquartered in New York. For over two decades, we’ve been delivering top-tier technology solutions to companies of all sizes, from innovative startups to industry leaders, helping them achieve their digital transformation goals.

By applying for this position, you’re taking the first step in joining a dynamic team that values your expertise and aspirations. We aim to align your skills with opportunities that foster exceptional career growth and success while contributing to transformative projects that shape the future.

Our Client

A financial service provider dedicated to helping under-served customers in emerging markets to achieve financial stability and success. We lend through our patented technology that turns a smartphone into digital collateral, and our cutting-edge machine learning, data science, and anti-fraud AI allow us to offer the lowest cost and qualify the most customers in the industry. As of 2025 we have brought billions of dollars in credit to 15 million customers, doubling in the last two years while remaining strongly profitable and sustainable for the long term.


Job Summary

The Senior Back-end is responsible for design, implementation and update software tools and manages APIs from third-party vendors for different products or teams to enhance the organization's performance in various areas.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain systems. Write clean, scalable, and efficient code to ensure robust and high-performance backend systems.

  • Implement and manage API connections from third-party vendors to enable seamless communication and enhance functionality.

  • Implement Test-Driven Development and execute unit and integration tests to maintain code quality and prevent bugs.

  • Create and maintain detailed documentation of software features to provide reliable references and facilitate onboarding.

  • Version Control Management to manage codebase changes and facilitate collaboration.

  • Conduct code reviews and perform testing to ensure high code quality and identify issues early.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline such as computer science, software engineering, or a related field.

  • 3+ years of experience as a Software Engineer.

  • Must be proficient in software engineering tools.

  • Ability to develop software in Python for the backend using Django and PostgreSQL.

  • Experience with test-driven development, document software functionality, and review and test the work of others.

  • Proficiency with Git for version control and Kubernetes for container orchestration.

  • Experience with APIs and integrations.

  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively.

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, enabling them to work effectively within a team and with various stakeholders.

  • Highly adaptable and open to learning, showing a proactive approach to staying updated with the latest industry trends and technologies.

  • Exhibit a strong sense of accountability and attention to detail, ensuring high-quality work.

  • Dependable and can manage their time efficiently, balancing multiple tasks and deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

What We Offer

  • 100% Company-funded Health and Dental insurance for employees and immediate family members.

  • Phone finance, Headphone, home office equipment and fitness perks.

  • $2,000 USD annual Co-working Travel perk.

  • $2,000 USD annual Professional Development perk.

Extra Info

It's required to go to the office in Cuidad del Saber Panama City, 3 times per week.

Apply now!
