Its associates embody core values such as putting members first, fostering inclusive diversity, and working collaboratively to deliver results that uphold promises and strengthen long-term relationships.


Job Summary

Are you ready to redefine how an entire industry engages with customers? This organization leverages technology to place human connection at the center of everything it does. For those who thrive on purpose and want to make a tangible difference in people’s lives when it matters most, it offers the opportunity to be part of a growing team on the path to becoming one of the top five life insurers in the U.S., supported by one of America’s most trusted brands. The strength of its culture and mission is reflected in several ways: employees rank highest in commitment, empathy, and dedication compared to top U.S. companies; its products reach tens of millions of Americans; it provides life insurance solutions that truly support families during their most difficult times rather than focusing on wealth management instruments; and it was recognized by USA Today as a nationwide top workplace in 2024.

Responsibilities

  • Lead a newly formed nearshore Acquisition Team in collaboration with the team’s Tech Lead.

  • Act as a primary point of contact for U.S.-based Product Owners and Solutions Architects.

  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to deeply understand their challenges and propose effective solutions.

  • Maintain and prioritize the team’s backlog, balancing competing priorities to maximize value delivery.

  • Oversee the execution of sprints and ensure alignment with business goals.

  • Facilitate retrospectives to drive learning and adaptation.

  • Contribute to the continuous improvement of agile practices and processes within the team.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • 5+ years of work experience, with 3+ years as a product manager or product owner.

  • A track record of increasing responsibility in product management.

  • Highly effective at leading teams without authority.

  • Experience developing and deploying features for a highly considered product or service.

  • Know when and how to craft qualitative and quantitative feature tests

  • Clear and concise written communication with proven ability to summarize large, complex, and conflicting data.

  • Experience at a high-growth startup or within insurance or financial services is a plus.

  • Strong understanding of agile principles and practices, with experience in managing backlogs, writing user stories, and facilitating sprints.

  • Proficiency in agile tools and software (e.g., JIRA, Confluence).

  • Familiarity with business analysis tools (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Visio) is advantageous.

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a knack for identifying and resolving issues efficiently.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, capable of articulating complex concepts clearly to various audiences.

  • Meticulous attention to detail with the tenacity to pursue complex problems.

What We Offer

  • 100% Remote Work: Enjoy the freedom to work from the location that helps you thrive. All it takes is a laptop and a reliable internet connection.

  • Highly Competitive USD Pay: Earn an excellent, market-leading compensation in USD, that goes beyond typical market offerings.

  • Paid Time Off: We value your well-being. Our paid time off policies ensure you have the chance to unwind and recharge when needed.

  • Work with Autonomy: Enjoy the freedom to manage your time as long as the work gets done. Focus on results, not the clock.

Why You’ll Like Working Here

  • A Culture That Values You: We prioritize well-being and work-life balance, offering engagement activities and fostering dynamic teams to ensure you thrive both personally and professionally.

  • Diverse, Global Network: Connect with over 600 professionals in 25+ countries, expand your network, and collaborate with a multicultural team from Latin America.

  • Team Up with Skilled Professionals: Join forces with senior talent. All of our team members are seasoned experts, ensuring you're working with the best in your field.

Job Summary

The Senior QA Engineer (SDET/Automation) plays a key role in ensuring the quality and reliability of products within the Consumer Solutions Team. This position is focused on designing, developing, and executing automated test frameworks, as well as maintaining robust testing strategies across web and mobile applications. The ideal candidate combines strong coding skills with deep QA expertise to create scalable, efficient, and reusable test automation solutions. Close collaboration with developers, product managers, and business stakeholders is essential to align testing efforts with business objectives, accelerate release cycles, and deliver a seamless consumer experience.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into effective QA strategies, aligning efforts with Agile sprint goals.

  • Troubleshoot, debug, and analyze distributed systems, contributing to root cause analysis and continuous improvement of testing practices.

  • Document test strategies, manage defects and test cases in JIRA, and integrate QA efforts into CI/CD pipelines for efficient delivery.

  • 5–9 years of QA experience with strong expertise in backend, API, and data testing.

Services span UX/UI design, web and mobile development, digital transformation, and creative marketing solutions tailored to modern consumer behavior.


Job Summary

Seeking a Senior Product Manager to lead the strategy and execution of complex engineering projects. This role involves collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver large-scale development initiatives, focusing on top-of-funnel user experiences, revenue technologies, and content management systems. Ideal candidates have a strong background in Agile methodologies, CMS platforms, and a proven track record in managing enterprise-level projects.

Responsibilities

  • Establish Project Frameworks: Define the structure for executing development projects, fostering team collaboration to achieve optimal outcomes.​

  • Evaluate and Plan Development Tasks: Assess wireframes and designs to determine complexity, then break down tasks, create timelines, and manage project backlogs for the development team.​

  • Comprehend Technical Specifications: Gain an in-depth understanding of product technicalities, including frontend architecture, CMS implementations, and various integrations such as site search, advertising, APIs, personalization tools, localization, internationalization, and analytics.​

  • Facilitate Agile Processes: Apply Agile principles and frameworks like Scrum and Kanban to guide delivery, including creating and managing issues in Jira, translating product roadmaps into actionable stories, maintaining backlogs, estimating tasks, and leading Agile ceremonies in collaboration with Client Engagement/Production leads and Technical Directors.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • Proficiency in Agile Methodologies: Demonstrated experience with Agile principles and frameworks, including Scrum, to facilitate efficient and adaptive project management. ​

  • Expertise with Atlassian Tools: Hands-on experience utilizing Atlassian’s suite of products, particularly Jira and Confluence, for effective project tracking and team collaboration. ​

Our client is a forward-thinking technology company dedicated to building innovative and scalable solutions that optimize data processing and analytics. They foster a culture of continuous learning, collaboration, and proactive problem-solving, empowering their teams to drive meaningful impact in the digital space.


Job Summary

We are seeking a detail-oriented Accessibility Tester to join our team. The Accessibility Tester will evaluate digital products, including websites, applications, and documents, to ensure compliance with accessibility standards such as WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines). This role is critical to ensuring an inclusive experience for all users, particularly those with disabilities

Responsibilities

Accessibility Testing:

  • Conduct manual and automated testing to ensure digital content and features comply with accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG 2.1, Section 508, ADA).

  • Use tools such as screen readers (e.g., JAWS, NVDA, VoiceOver), accessibility checkers (e.g., Axe, WAVE), and other testing tools.

Analysis and Reporting:

  • Identify and document accessibility issues, including barriers faced by users with visual, auditory, cognitive, or motor disabilities.

  • Provide clear and actionable feedback to development teams and stakeholders.

  • Prioritize issues based on impact and severity.

Collaboration:

  • Work closely with designers, developers, and content creators to guide accessibility best practices.

  • Participate in accessibility review meetings to discuss findings and solutions.

Training and Advocacy:

  • Stay updated on the latest accessibility standards, tools, and techniques.

  • Educate team members on accessibility requirements and advocate for inclusive design.

Documentation:

  • Maintain detailed records of test results and issue resolution.

  • Assist in creating accessibility documentation, such as conformance statements and VPATs (Voluntary Product Accessibility Templates)

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • Proven experience in accessibility testing and evaluation across web, mobile web, and native applications

  • Strong knowledge of WCAG 2.1/2.2, Section 508, and ARIA

  • Proficient in HTML, CSS, JavaScript from an accessibility standpoint

  • Hands-on experience with assistive technologies and tools (JAWS, NVDA, VoiceOver; Axe, WAVE, ANDI, Accessibility Insights, AccessAssistant)

  • Deep expertise in at least one screen reader (JAWS or NVDA) and one testing tool/plugin

  • Experience creating or contributing to accessibility documentation, including VPATs

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills

  • Ability to work independently and proactively with cross-functional teams

At Truelogic we are a leading provider of nearshore staff augmentation services headquartered in New York. For over two decades, we’ve been delivering top-tier technology solutions to companies of all sizes, from innovative startups to industry leaders, helping them achieve their digital transformation goals.

Our team of 600+ highly skilled tech professionals, based in Latin America, drives digital disruption by partnering with U.S. companies on their most impactful projects. Whether collaborating with Fortune 500 giants or scaling startups, we deliver results that make a difference.

By applying for this position, you’re taking the first step in joining a dynamic team that values your expertise and aspirations. We aim to align your skills with opportunities that foster exceptional career growth and success while contributing to transformative projects that shape the future.

Our Client

A leading digital mortgage lender in the U.S., recognized for revolutionizing the home loan experience through cutting-edge technology and customer-centric innovation. With over 4 million lifetime customers and a fully remote workforce of more than 3,000 professionals, the company combines the scale of a national financial institution with the agility of a tech-forward startup. Consistently ranked among the top mortgage providers in the country, it offers competitive rates, exceptional online service, and a fast, transparent lending process that empowers homebuyers and homeowners nationwide.


Job Summary

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Quality Assurance Engineer to join our team and ensure the delivery of exceptional software products. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in both manual and automated testing, including API, system, UI, and functional testing. This role involves designing and implementing robust test strategies, developing automation tools, and collaborating closely with development, operations, and business teams to maintain the highest quality standards across all product releases. The Senior QA Engineer will also drive innovation by integrating AI tools for test automation and improving overall QA processes.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and execute manual and automated test cases across UI, API, and system levels.

  • Perform black box, white box, functional, and performance testing to ensure product quality.

  • Review project requirements, specifications, and documentation to ensure comprehensive test coverage.

  • Create, maintain, and enforce test automation standards, policies, and procedures.

  • Facilitate defect resolution, track issues through retesting, and ensure closure.

  • Define, track, and report QA KPIs and metrics to measure test effectiveness and product quality.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify gaps, risks, and opportunities for process improvements.

  • Participate in Agile ceremonies, providing input on testing, quality assurance, and release readiness.

  • Explore and integrate AI tools to enhance automated test script creation and execution.

  • Perform other duties as assigned, supporting the organization’s culture and values.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience supporting full product release cycles, including production deployments.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience.

  • Strong experience with test and defect management processes.

  • Demonstrated expertise in Agile development environments.

  • Proficiency in test automation frameworks and tools; experience with Playwright and Java preferred.

  • Solid experience in both manual and automated functional testing.

  • Performance testing experience using JMeter or equivalent tools.

  • Knowledge of integrating AI tools for automated test script generation.

  • Ability to create and maintain detailed test plans, test cases, and test scripts.

  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

  • Detail-oriented, proactive, and committed to delivering high-quality software products.

What We Offer

  • 100% Remote Work: Enjoy the freedom to work from the location that helps you thrive. All it takes is a laptop and a reliable internet connection.

  • Highly Competitive USD Pay: Earn an excellent, market-leading compensation in USD, that goes beyond typical market offerings.

  • Paid Time Off: We value your well-being. Our paid time off policies ensure you have the chance to unwind and recharge when needed.

  • Work with Autonomy: Enjoy the freedom to manage your time as long as the work gets done. Focus on results, not the clock.

  • Work with Top American Companies: Grow your expertise working on innovative, high-impact projects with Industry-Leading U.S. Companies.

Why You’ll Like Working Here

  • A Culture That Values You: We prioritize well-being and work-life balance, offering engagement activities and fostering dynamic teams to ensure you thrive both personally and professionally.

  • Diverse, Global Network: Connect with over 600 professionals in 25+ countries, expand your network, and collaborate with a multicultural team from Latin America.

  • Team Up with Skilled Professionals: Join forces with senior talent. All of our team members are seasoned experts, ensuring you're working with the best in your field.

Apply now!

  • Comprehend Technical Specifications: Gain an in-depth understanding of product technicalities, including frontend architecture, CMS implementations, and various integrations such as site search, advertising, APIs, personalization tools, localization, internationalization, and analytics.​

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • Proficiency in Agile Methodologies: Demonstrated experience with Agile principles and frameworks, including Scrum, to facilitate efficient and adaptive project management. ​

  • Expertise with Atlassian Tools: Hands-on experience utilizing Atlassian’s suite of products, particularly Jira and Confluence, for effective project tracking and team collaboration. ​

  • CMS Platform Experience: Proven track record working with widely-used Content Management Systems such as Contentful, Drupal, WordPress, or Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), ensuring seamless content operations. ​

  • Enterprise-Level Project Delivery: Successful participation in the delivery and deployment of large-scale engineering projects, encompassing both principal development and ongoing maintenance phases. ​

  • Product Ownership Mentality: Ability to take full ownership of the product lifecycle, from strategic planning to execution, ensuring alignment with business objectives and user needs.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Truelogic

At Truelogic we are a leading provider of nearshore staff augmentation services headquartered in New York. For over two decades, we’ve been delivering top-tier technology solutions to companies of all sizes, from innovative startups to industry leaders, helping them achieve their digital transformation goals.

Our team of 600+ highly skilled tech professionals, based in Latin America, drives digital disruption by partnering with U.S. companies on their most impactful projects. Whether collaborating with Fortune 500 giants or scaling startups, we deliver results that make a difference.

By applying for this position, you’re taking the first step in joining a dynamic team that values your expertise and aspirations. We aim to align your skills with opportunities that foster exceptional career growth and success while contributing to transformative projects that shape the future.

Our Client

Our client is a forward-thinking technology company dedicated to building innovative and scalable solutions that optimize data processing and analytics. They foster a culture of continuous learning, collaboration, and proactive problem-solving, empowering their teams to drive meaningful impact in the digital space.


Job Summary

We are seeking a detail-oriented Accessibility Tester to join our team. The Accessibility Tester will evaluate digital products, including websites, applications, and documents, to ensure compliance with accessibility standards such as WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines). This role is critical to ensuring an inclusive experience for all users, particularly those with disabilities

Responsibilities

Accessibility Testing:

  • Conduct manual and automated testing to ensure digital content and features comply with accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG 2.1, Section 508, ADA).

  • Use tools such as screen readers (e.g., JAWS, NVDA, VoiceOver), accessibility checkers (e.g., Axe, WAVE), and other testing tools.

Analysis and Reporting:

  • Identify and document accessibility issues, including barriers faced by users with visual, auditory, cognitive, or motor disabilities.

  • Provide clear and actionable feedback to development teams and stakeholders.

  • Prioritize issues based on impact and severity.

Collaboration:

  • Work closely with designers, developers, and content creators to guide accessibility best practices.

  • Participate in accessibility review meetings to discuss findings and solutions.

Training and Advocacy:

  • Stay updated on the latest accessibility standards, tools, and techniques.

  • Educate team members on accessibility requirements and advocate for inclusive design.

Documentation:

  • Maintain detailed records of test results and issue resolution.

  • Assist in creating accessibility documentation, such as conformance statements and VPATs (Voluntary Product Accessibility Templates)

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • Proven experience in accessibility testing and evaluation across web, mobile web, and native applications

  • Strong knowledge of WCAG 2.1/2.2, Section 508, and ARIA

  • Proficient in HTML, CSS, JavaScript from an accessibility standpoint

  • Hands-on experience with assistive technologies and tools (JAWS, NVDA, VoiceOver; Axe, WAVE, ANDI, Accessibility Insights, AccessAssistant)

  • Deep expertise in at least one screen reader (JAWS or NVDA) and one testing tool/plugin

  • Experience creating or contributing to accessibility documentation, including VPATs

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills

  • Ability to work independently and proactively with cross-functional teams

What We Offer

  • 100% Remote Work: Enjoy the freedom to work from the location that helps you thrive. All it takes is a laptop and a reliable internet connection.

  • Highly Competitive USD Pay: Earn an excellent, market-leading compensation in USD, that goes beyond typical market offerings.

  • Paid Time Off: We value your well-being. Our paid time off policies ensure you have the chance to unwind and recharge when needed.

  • Work with Autonomy: Enjoy the freedom to manage your time as long as the work gets done. Focus on results, not the clock.

Why You’ll Like Working Here

  • Diverse, Global Network: Connect with over 600 professionals in 25+ countries, expand your network, and collaborate with a multicultural team from Latin America.

Job Summary

We are seeking a Senior ML+DevOps Engineer to architect and scale AI/ML infrastructure for next-generation digital experiences. This role is central to building robust, production-grade MLOps pipelines, ensuring seamless deployment, monitoring, and optimization of machine learning models. The ideal candidate brings deep expertise in Python, containerization, and cloud platforms, with hands-on experience delivering end-to-end MLOps solutions. You will collaborate closely with data scientists, engineers, and product teams to power AI-driven publishing technologies, content automation, and intelligent pipelines.

Responsibilities

  • Design and implement end-to-end MLOps pipelines for training, deployment, and inference.

  • Build and maintain Python-based APIs (FastAPI) to support ML workflows and data ingestion.

  • Configure and manage cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, Azure) to support AI/ML workloads.

  • Automate deployment, scaling, and monitoring of models using Docker and CI/CD pipelines.

  • Implement observability, logging, and alerting with tools like CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana, and GCP logging.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define requirements and deliver scalable MLOps solutions.

  • Optimize model performance and system reliability while troubleshooting production issues.

  • Apply infrastructure-as-code practices (Terraform) for reproducible and maintainable deployments.

  • Stay ahead of industry best practices in MLOps, cloud-native engineering, and AI/ML integration.

  • Proven experience designing and implementing end-to-end MLOps pipelines for model training and inference.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Truelogic

At Truelogic we are a leading provider of nearshore staff augmentation services headquartered in New York. Our Client

Our client is creating a fundamentally better healthcare experience for people with chronic health conditions and those that care for them. We make healthcare more accessible by simplifying complex care plans, connecting care teams and meeting patients where they live. Through our conversational AI, patients use their voice to interact with our digital care companion, who proactively gives medication reminders, symptom checks, behavioral nudges and even engages in friendly conversation to ease loneliness. Our client uses radar to put the patient in context and passively monitors their activities, including: heart rate, breathing rate and sleep stages, all without a wearable. The result is informed and timely intervention that drives improved clinical outcomes, reduced care delivery costs and a more satisfactory healthcare experience for all.


Job Summary

Our Client

This network is the only one with a balance of 50% creative talent and 50% engineers at scale. As the technology-first group within Stagwell, it is built to partner with businesses to navigate the complexity of changing consumer behaviors, emerging technologies, and AI. With a global footprint and the capabilities to work across the entire consumer journey, the group thrives on solving the hardest challenges.

The network includes agencies such as Kettle, Mediacurrent, Rhythm, and Truelogic. Its clients include Amazon, JPMorgan Chase, Microsoft, MSNBC, NFL, Pfizer, and Zappos.


Job Summary

We are seeking a Product Owner / Business Analyst with expertise in Adobe Experience Cloud, including AEM, AEP, Workfront, Analytics, and Target. The ideal candidate will bridge the gap between business and technology teams, gathering requirements, defining product roadmaps, and ensuring the successful implementation of Adobe solutions to drive digital transformation. This role requires strong analytical skills, a deep understanding of marketing technology, and experience working with cross-functional teams to deliver scalable and innovative solutions.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define and prioritize business requirements for Adobe Experience Cloud solutions.

  • Develop and maintain product roadmaps, ensuring alignment with business objectives and user needs.

  • Act as the primary liaison between business users, technical teams, and Adobe consultants to drive solution design and implementation.

  • Define and document business processes, user stories, acceptance criteria, and functional specifications.

  • Oversee the end-to-end implementation of Adobe solutions, ensuring seamless integration across AEM, AEP CDP, CJA, Workfront, Analytics, and Target.

  • Support change management efforts, user adoption, and training to maximize the value of Adobe Experience Cloud products.

  • Ensure compliance with best practices, governance policies, and industry standards for data security and privacy.

  • Facilitate workshops, sprint planning, and backlog grooming sessions with agile development teams.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • Strong understanding of AEM (Adobe Experience Manager) and Workfront.

  • Experience defining and managing digital marketing and content strategies within enterprise environments.

  • Hands-on experience gathering requirements, writing user stories, and managing product backlogs.

  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills to align business and technical teams.

  • Understanding of Agile and Scrum methodologies in a digital marketing or enterprise setting.

  • 7–10 years of experience in business analysis, product ownership, or digital marketing technology roles.

  • Advise on scaling architecture and backend tools (e.g., Portless for logistics)

Our Client

We are a technology-enabled company providing flexible financing solutions to small and medium-sized businesses. Since 2008, we have supported over 55,000 merchants across the U.S., delivering more than $4 billion in capital for a wide range of needs—from covering operating expenses and managing cash flow gaps to fueling business growth. By leveraging proprietary technology, we streamline the funding process so that businesses can access capital in as little as 24 hours, compared to the weeks or even months it typically takes to secure a traditional bank loan.


Job Summary

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Engineer to join our growing data team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience designing, building, and maintaining robust data pipelines and architectures on Azure, while working with a variety of analytics and data integration tools. This role will be instrumental in supporting data-driven decision-making across multiple business units by ensuring our data infrastructure is reliable, scalable, and efficient.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL/ELT workflows to support business intelligence and analytics initiatives.

  • Architect and implement data solutions in Azure, leveraging services such as Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse, and Azure Storage.

  • Integrate data from various sources including SQL Server, Debezium change data capture (CDC) streams, Snowflake, and other third-party platforms.

  • Implement and manage dbt (Data Build Tool) transformations to create modular, testable, and maintainable data models.

  • Optimize and manage data warehouses and data lakes to support reporting, analytics, and machine learning workloads.

  • Ensure data quality, governance, and security across the entire data ecosystem.

  • Monitor pipeline performance, troubleshoot issues, and ensure high availability and data integrity.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field.

  • 3+ years of experience in data engineering or a related role.

  • Strong hands-on experience with Azure cloud services (e.g., Data Factory, Synapse, Data Lake, Functions, Logic Apps).

  • Expertise in SQL and experience with Azure SQL and SQL Server.

  • Experience implementing Debezium for CDC pipelines.

  • Proficiency with dbt for data modeling and transformation.

  • Strong knowledge of Snowflake including performance tuning, schema design, and data loading.

  • Experience working with multiple site analytics data sources (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.).

  • Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data modeling, and ETL/ELT best practices.

  • Proficiency in Python programming language for data processing.

Job Summary

Lead software/IT initiatives in a staff‑augmentation setting—ranging from a single dedicated engagement to multiple concurrent client engagements. Assignments may be part‑time or full‑time, and in some cases you will serve as Project Manager and/or Scrum Master for the team. You’ll orchestrate delivery, align diverse stakeholders (up to C‑level), and drive clarity, predictability, and healthy execution.

Responsibilities

  • Initiation & onboarding: set ways of working with clients, confirm expectations and escalation paths, secure access/credentials, and ensure a clean kick‑off

  • Planning & flow: maintain a solid planning cadence (backlog health, capacity awareness, realistic commitments); keep scope/quality/time in balance and reduce waste

  • Delivery management: run Agile ceremonies, uphold Definition of Ready/Done for work items, manage changes/hotfixes, and keep releases on track without disrupting the roadmap.

  • Risk & issue handling: identify risks early, communicate impact and trade‑offs, execute recovery plans, and escalate thoughtfully when needed.

  • Stakeholders & communication: keep Product, Design, Architecture, QA, and client decision‑makers aligned; communicate changes, dependencies, and outcomes with clarity.

  • Team enablement: remove blockers, clarify requirements, foster accountability and continuous improvement across one or more teams.

  • Light reporting & hygiene: keep status crisp and ensure time approval/reporting processes don’t become delivery surprises.

  • Productivity & efficiency: plans that fit capacity, fewer reworks/surprises, smoother handoffs and releases.

  • Requirements health: well‑formed work (clear acceptance criteria, scope understood, realistic estimation) and less churn.

  • Predictability: credible commitments, transparent trade‑offs, timely communication when plans need to adapt.

  • Stakeholder confidence: consistent, proactive updates and follow‑through that earn trust.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • 5+ years in Project Management for software/IT (web/mobile).

  • Hands‑on Agile (Scrum/Kanban) across discovery → MVP → iterative delivery.

  • Comfort engaging multiple stakeholders (incl. executives); excellent written and spoken English.

  • Proven ability to run kick‑offs, keep plans/requirements healthy, manage changes/hotfixes, and keep teams unblocked.

  • Fluency with Jira and Confluence (or similar), and standard collaboration/video tools; familiarity with time approval/reporting processes.

  • Initiative & ownership: You anticipate issues, propose options, take responsibility end‑to‑end, and close loops.

  • Concise, executive‑ready communication: You get to the point, tailor to the audience, and are comfortable briefing C‑level; you communicate impact, options, and asks, and follow up in writing quickly.

  • Escalation that adds value: You escalate with context, quantified impact, and clear options; you drive decisions and closure—not noise.

  • Team support & enablement: You unblock, clarify requirements, and create conditions for the team to do their best work; you coach without micromanaging.

  • Value‑add presence: Clients and teammates consistently feel your participation moves the project forward and improves outcomes.

This role will be instrumental in supporting data-driven decision-making across multiple business units by ensuring our data infrastructure is reliable, scalable, and efficient.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL/ELT workflows to support business intelligence and analytics initiatives.

  • Architect and implement data solutions in Azure, leveraging services such as Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse, and Azure Storage.

  • Integrate data from various sources including SQL Server, Debezium change data capture (CDC) streams, Snowflake, and other third-party platforms.

  • Implement and manage dbt (Data Build Tool) transformations to create modular, testable, and maintainable data models.

  • Optimize and manage data warehouses and data lakes to support reporting, analytics, and machine learning workloads.

  • Ensure data quality, governance, and security across the entire data ecosystem.

  • Monitor pipeline performance, troubleshoot issues, and ensure high availability and data integrity.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field.

  • 3+ years of experience in data engineering or a related role.

  • Strong hands-on experience with Azure cloud services (e.g., Data Factory, Synapse, Data Lake, Functions, Logic Apps).

  • Expertise in SQL and experience with Azure SQL and SQL Server.

  • Experience implementing Debezium for CDC pipelines.

  • Proficiency with dbt for data modeling and transformation.

  • Strong knowledge of Snowflake including performance tuning, schema design, and data loading.

  • Experience working with multiple site analytics data sources (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.).

  • Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data modeling, and ETL/ELT best practices.

  • Proficiency in Python programming language for data processing.

Our Client

A B2B digital marketing agency that helps associations and businesses reach, engage, and grow their key audiences. It combines media expertise with first-party audience data to maximize brand reach and revenue potential.


Job Summary

The Senior Frontend UI Developer is responsible for designing and implementing secure, accessible, and maintainable user interfaces using ASP.NET Core MVC and Razor Pages. This role ensures seamless integration with the company’s DDD-based Onion Architecture while adhering to enterprise standards for security, performance, and scalability.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain Razor Views, View Components, and Partials for high-traffic, server-rendered applications.

  • Implement post-back (POST-Redirect-GET) workflows for reliable form handling.

  • Collaborate with backend teams to integrate OpenAPI-defined services via strongly typed façade layers.

  • Ensure consistent branding, accessibility, and responsiveness using Tailwind CSS or equivalent frameworks.

  • Enhance user experience with minimal progressive enhancements like HTMX or lightweight JavaScript.

  • Maintain clean architecture by keeping the presentation layer dependent only on domain abstractions.

  • Test thoroughly through unit, integration, and end-to-end tests covering key user flows.

  • Contribute to shared UI libraries and reusable component patterns.

  • Participate actively in sprints, code reviews, and releases within an Agile/Kanban process using Azure DevOps.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • 8 years of professional web development experience, including at least 5 years working with ASP.NET Core MVC/Razor.

  • Strong understanding of server-side rendering, HTTP lifecycle, and form security best practices (antiforgery tokens, validation, and POST-Redirect-GET pattern).

  • Familiarity with Domain-Driven Design (DDD) concepts and understanding of how the presentation layer fits into Onion or Hexagonal architectures.

  • Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, and modern responsive design principles (experience with Tailwind CSS preferred).

  • Basic knowledge of HTMX, Alpine.js, or similar lightweight front-end enhancement libraries.

  • Experience working with Azure DevOps (Repos, Pipelines, Boards) within Agile or Kanban environments.

  • Strong testing discipline using xUnit, MSTest, or Playwright.

  • Excellent collaboration skills, with strong attention to architectural consistency, code quality, and user experience.

Job Summary

The Senior Frontend UI Developer is responsible for designing and implementing secure, accessible, and maintainable user interfaces using ASP.NET Core MVC and Razor Pages. This role ensures seamless integration with the company’s DDD-based Onion Architecture while adhering to enterprise standards for security, performance, and scalability.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain Razor Views, View Components, and Partials for high-traffic, server-rendered applications.

  • Implement post-back (POST-Redirect-GET) workflows for reliable form handling.

  • Collaborate with backend teams to integrate OpenAPI-defined services via strongly typed façade layers.

  • Ensure consistent branding, accessibility, and responsiveness using Tailwind CSS or equivalent frameworks.

  • Enhance user experience with minimal progressive enhancements like HTMX or lightweight JavaScript.

  • Maintain clean architecture by keeping the presentation layer dependent only on domain abstractions.

  • Contribute to shared UI libraries and reusable component patterns.

  • Develop and optimize MS SQL Server schemas, queries, and stored procedures.

  • Collaborate closely with front-end teams to build, maintain, and optimize Angular components.

  • Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code, ensuring quality through comprehensive self-testing (unit, integration, etc.).

  • Use AI-powered tools (e.g., GitHub Copilot, Amazon CodeWhisperer, ChatGPT) to improve development speed and quality.

  • Troubleshoot complex issues across development, testing, and production environments.

  • Use GIT for version control and contribute to modern CI/CD pipelines.

Our Client

A B2B digital marketing agency that helps associations and businesses reach, engage, and grow their key audiences. It combines media expertise with first-party audience data to maximize brand reach and revenue potential.


Job Summary

The role involves developing a new system designed to streamline and optimize the management of advertisers, campaigns, and ad groups across multiple advertising platforms and ad servers. The position focuses on building scalable, secure, and maintainable backend services that will power the next generation of ad management and reporting tools. The ideal candidate will work closely with cross-functional teams to design efficient architectures, ensure data integrity and system performance, and contribute to a robust, future-ready digital advertising ecosystem

Responsibilities

  • Design and implement backend services and Web APIs following OpenAPI (Swagger) standards, ensuring scalability and maintainability.

  • Develop efficient, modular, and testable code using C# .NET 6+ and Entity Framework (code-first), applying Dependency Injection and interface-based programming principles.

  • Design and optimize SQL Server data models and queries, ensuring high performance and data integrity.

  • Deploy and maintain cloud services in Microsoft Azure, leveraging PaaS solutions and integrating secure authentication via Okta or similar Identity Providers.

  • Collaborate within an Agile (Scrum) environment, managing CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps and ensuring quality through unit and integration testing.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience developing backend systems with C#/.NET 6 or higher, including building and documenting RESTful APIs using Swagger/OpenAPI.

  • Strong knowledge of software architecture and design principles, including Dependency Injection, IoC containers, and best practices for scalable systems.

  • Proficiency in SQL Server and Entity Framework (Code-First Migrations), with experience optimizing queries and database performance.

  • Hands-on experience deploying and maintaining cloud services in Azure, managing CI/CD pipelines and version control through Azure DevOps.

  • Familiarity with Okta or similar identity providers for security integration, and working knowledge of Blazor and automated testing frameworks (unit and integration tests).

Responsible for designing, building, and maintaining secure, enterprise-grade APIs that follow the company’s Domain Driven Design (DDD) and Onion/Hexagonal hybrid architecture. This role emphasizes adherence to the organization’s reference architecture, SOLID principles, and OpenAPI-first design, ensuring consistent, maintainable, and scalable solutions across all systems.

Responsibilities

  • Design and implement .NET 8 Web APIs aligned with DDD and Onion Architecture standards.

  • Develop domain models, application services, and infrastructure layers that communicate through well-defined abstractions.

  • Enforce SOLID principles and dependency inversion: outer layers depend only on abstractions, never implementations.

  • Build and document OpenAPI (Swagger) specifications with Swashbuckle/NSwag for strong, versioned API contracts.

  • Integrate securely with Azure App Services, Azure API Management, Azure Key Vault, and Azure Configuration.

  • Implement Okta-based authentication and authorization for API security.

  • Apply resiliency patterns using HttpClientFactory and monitor services via Azure Application Insights and HealthChecks.

  • Develop performant data persistence patterns with SQL Server, ensuring proper transaction handling and optimization.

  • Write and maintain unit, integration, and contract tests to validate all API and service-layer functionality.

  • Collaborate within an Azure DevOps Agile/Kanban environment, contributing to sprint planning, peer reviews, and continuous delivery pipelines.

  • Ensure all solutions conform to enterprise reference architecture and deployment standards.

Qualifications and Job Requirements

  • 8+ years of professional software development experience, with at least 5 years in .NET Core /ASP.NET Core Web API.

  • Proven experience implementing DDD, Onion, or Hexagonal architectural patterns.

  • Strong understanding of C# 12, .NET 8, dependency injection, and asynchronous programming.

  • Expertise in OpenAPI-first development, Swashbuckle tooling.

  • Solid experience with Azure App Services, APIM, Key Vault, Application Insights, and Azure Configuration.
